parts.name: Ford Explorer 8.8" Rear Axle Swap
parts.description: The Ford Explorer (1995-2001) 8.8-inch rear axle is a legendary swap for Ford Rangers, Jeep Wranglers (YJ/TJ), and Jeep Cherokees (XJ). It is significantly stronger than the stock Ranger 7.5" or Jeep Dana 35.
specs: Width is almost identical to Ranger

models.name: Ranger
models.notes: Direct bolt-in (spring perches may need moving for lift)

parts.name: Ford Explorer Power Leather Seats
parts.description: Front seats from a 1995-2001 Ford Explorer (or Mercury Mountaineer) are a direct bolt-in upgrade for 1998-2011 Ford Rangers and Mazda B-Series trucks. Much more comfortable than the stock Ranger bench or buckets.
specs: Direct bolt-in for Extended Cab Rangers
Standard Cab Rangers may require swapping seat tracks from original seats
Power wiring requires running 12V and Ground

parts.name: Ford Explorer Overhead Console
parts.description: The overhead console from a 1995-2001 Explorer (featuring compass, thermometer, and map lights) can be installed into a Ranger. Requires cutting the headliner and running a few wires.
specs: Requires temp sensor from donor (mounted behind grille)
Grab the mounting bracket from the donor roof

parts.name: Chevy 64-inch Leaf Spring Swap
parts.description: Using 64-inch leaf springs from a 1988-1998 Chevy 1500 (OBS) on a Ford Ranger provides massive suspension travel and a smoother ride for off-road builds. Known as the 'Chevy 64 swap'.
specs: Requires moving front spring hangers forward

parts.name: Ford Mustang Wheels on Ranger
parts.description: Ford Ranger and Ford Mustang share the same 5x114.3 (5x4.5) bolt pattern. Many Mustang wheels fit Rangers, though offsets differ. Newer Mustang wheels (S197/S550) have high positive offset and may require spacers.
